net.java.jddac.jmdi.fblock
Class FunctionBlock

java.lang.Object
  net.java.jddac.common.fblock.Entity
      net.java.jddac.jmdi.fblock.FunctionBlock
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConfigurationInterface, SubscriberCallback
Direct Known Subclasses:
BasicTIM, BasicTransducerBlock, DbConMgrBlock, DefaultCoder, DefaultXmlCoder, EchoBlock, ErrorChannelSplitter, GenericStoreBlock, HttpTransport, HttpTransportJ2me, JddacServerDataBlock, JFreeChartBlock, LogAdminBlock, LogFileHandlerBlock, LogJdbcHandlerBlock, LogStdoutHandlerBlock, MeasStoreBlock, MessageQueueBlock, MiniAlarmBlock, NCAPBlock, NRSSBlock, PubDiagBlock, RenamePubBlock, ReportDbAccess, Reporter, ReportOnChangeBlock, ServerInfoBlock, TransportBridgeBlock
public abstract class FunctionBlock
extends Entity
implements SubscriberCallback

FunctionBlock abstraction from IEEE 1451.1 standard. All FunctionBlock objects in the system should inherit from this class.

Function Blocks are the fundamental building pieces of JDDAC applications. All JDDAC applications, irregardless of the platform or the domain, will be composed of Function Block instances connected via a pub-sub infrastructure for passing measurements from one block instance to the next. Thus, Function Blocks are first class entities in the JDDAC universe.

In all instances, a developer of a function block will inherit from this FunctionBlock class. This base class provides a number of services such as tracking the life cycle state information, handling the client-server method dispatching, and the management of the pub-sub infrastructure.

A class dervied from Function Block should override the notifySubscriber() method to receive publications, perform() to receive client-server method invocations, and configure() to receive any runtime configurations from the configuration XML files.

perform

public ArgArray perform(java.lang.String server_operation_id,
                        ArgArray server_input_arguments)
                 throws java.lang.Exception,
                        OpException
Handles client-server method invocations. The OpIDs handled by this class are:

  • OpIdConfigure
  • OpIdGetGroupIDs
  • OpIdGetBlockMajorState
  • OpIdGetAllMetaData
  • OpIdGetMetaData

notifySubscriber

public void notifySubscriber(short publication_id,
                             java.lang.String publicationTopic,
                             ArgArray inArgs)
                      throws OpException
required method for SubscriberCallback. This method is provided so that sub-classes do not need to do anything if they want to ignore publications. Typically, a class which inherits from FunctionBlock will override this method with its own.

publishDeferred

protected void publishDeferred(int portNum,
                               ArgArray publication_contents)
                        throws OpException
Utility method to simplify internal publications. Used to publish an ArgArray to a port. This method will queue the publication onto a separate thread. This is useful when the publishing thread holds synchronization locks it is unable to release when doing the publish.

Parameters:
portNum - starts at 1
Throws:
OpException

publish

                       ArgArray publication_contents)
                throws OpException

callLocal

public ArgArray callLocal(java.lang.String blkName,
                          java.lang.String opId,
                          ArgArray parms)
                   throws OpException,
                          java.lang.Exception
Call the perform method on a block registered with the local NCAP.

Parameters:
blkName - - A String containing the instance name of the block to call the perform method on.
opId - - A String containing the opId to call the perform method with.
parms - - An ArgArray containing the parameters to pass as the server_input_arguments.
Returns:
- an ArgArray containing the results of the perform method.
Throws:
OpException
java.lang.Exception

getPubIDFromName

protected short getPubIDFromName(java.lang.String pubName)
Given the name of a publisher port, return its autoassigned publication ID. This is useful when you wish to publish on a topic and needs to know what the assigned ID is to use the publish() helper method.

Parameters:
pubName - - A String instance representing the publisher port name to query.
Returns:
- The publication ID

Returns:
- The subscription ID

configure

public void configure(ArgArray configuration)
               throws java.lang.Exception
Description copied from interface: ConfigurationInterface
Provides a method to configure object properties. The registry argument contains an ArgArray composed named values. Any values that are not specified are assumed to be left unchanged. That is, if a value is not present, do not assume it means 0 or true or some other default. This allows the configure method to be used to set a single value without affecting other values.

Specified by:
configure in interface ConfigurationInterface
Overrides:
configure in class Entity
Parameters:
configuration - contains incoming configuration parameters as named values.

Name Default Description
FunctionBlock.pubPorts null This section is where the publication topics for the Function Block is specified. There should be an ArgArray named 'result' contained within this section, containing an Argument named 'topic' for each topic that the block is subscribed to. Here is an example: storeMeasurement triggerAlarm

In this example, the block publishes on two topics: storeMeasurement and triggerAlarm.
FunctionBlock.subPorts null This section is where the sybscription topics for the Function Block is specified. There should be an ArgArray named 'trigger' contained within this section, containing an Argument named 'qual' for each topic that the block is subscribed to. Here is an example which defines a "trigger" port that subscribes to the topics "triggerAlarm" and "storeMeasurement": storeMeasurement triggerAlarm

In this example, the block subscribes on two subscription qualifiers: storeMeasurement and triggerAlarm.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
ConfigurationInterface.configure(net.java.jddac.common.type.ArgArray)
